title: 5 Simple Steps to Add a New Book or Edition to Goodreads

steps.title: Confirm the book you want to add isn't already listed.
steps.content: Confirm the book you want to add isn't already listed. Visit the Goodreads website in your browser and log into your account . Use the search bar to search for the book by name, author's name, ISBN (13 digit/generally starts with '978'), or ISBN (10 digit-old style ISBN barcode number). [1] X Research source You can use Goodreads to keep track of reading goals , participate in challenges , and even cultivate a stronger love for reading . If the book doesn't show up, proceed to the next step.

steps.title: Join the "Goodreads Librarians Group".
steps.content: Join the "Goodreads Librarians Group". To add a new book to Goodreads, you must send a request through the forums of this group. To post a request, you must be a member. Do the following: Make sure you're logged into your Goodreads account. Go to the Goodreads Librarians Group webpage . Click Join Group underneath the profile picture. Select an email setting. Click Join Group again.

steps.title: Create a new thread in the group.
steps.content: Create a new thread in the group. You can click the Adding New Books & Editions folder and then click new topic or you can follow this link to be redirected there.

steps.title: Compose your request.
steps.content: Compose your request. The "topic" field can be the book title you want to add. You must provide all of the following components for your request to be considered. Additionally, specify the language if the book is in a language other than English. You must provide: Title Author(s) name(s) ISBN (or ASIN) Publisher Publication date Format Page count Description Link to book page (must be a non-bookseller site, such as a publisher site, author site, etc.)

steps.title: Click Post.
steps.content: Click Post . This will publish your request in the Goodreads Librarians Group. A volunteer Librarian should respond to your request within 1-2 days, but this will depend on the current number of requests.
